p: Regarding the mode of action, several mechanisms through which essential oils produce neurotoxic effects have been proposed, such as EOs acting on GABA receptors, octopamine receptors, or acetylcholinesterase [ 30]. Further, the synergistic effect of the essential oil constituents likely increases their larvicidal activity [ 31, 32, 33]. Scalerandi et al. proposed an interesting mode for synergistic effects using the metabolic model [ 34]. They have shown that while the major component in the mixture is targeted by the detoxification system of the insect, the minor component intoxicates the insect. As a result, the minor component will be more toxic than when it was assayed alone since the detoxification system of the insect fights the main component.
